intro: Calycothrix billardierei, commonly known as the slender rock-rush, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It is adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in full sun. Calycothrix billardierei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
